text: Ethics is a branch of philosophy that involves systematizing, defending, and recommending concepts of right and wrong conduct. Ethics may also refer to: * Ethics (Bonhoeffer book), an unfinished book by Dietrich Bonhoeffer, published in 1949 * Ethics (journal), a quarterly philosophical journal * Ethics (Spinoza book), a 17th-century book by Baruch Spinoza * "Ethics" (Star Trek: The Next Generation), a 1992 episode of Star Trek: The Next Generation * Ethics (Watsuji book), a 1937 book by Tetsuro Watsuji * Ethics: Origin and Development, a 1921 book by Peter Kropotkin * Nicomachean Ethics or The Ethics, a work by Aristotle * Ethics, a 1912 book by G. E. Moore ==See also== * Animal ethics, human–animal relationships and how animals ought to be treated * Applied ethics, the branch of ethics concerned with the analysis of particular moral issues in private and public life * Business ethics, ethical principles and moral or ethical problems that can arise in a business environment * Medical ethics, a system of moral principles that apply values to the practice of clinical medicine and in scientific research
title: Ethics (disambiguation)
